channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minneapolis union president talks about economic blackout to protest ICE's actions
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Chelsie Glaubitz Gabiou, president of the Minneapolis Regional Labor Federation, AFL-CIO, which endorsed an economic blackout in protest of ICE's actions.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Chelsie Glaubitz Gabiou, president of the Minneapolis Regional Labor Federation, AFL-CIO, which endorsed an economic blackout in protest of ICE's actions.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Statewide economic blackout planned in Minnesota to protest ICE enforcement
item.description: Many businesses in Minnesota will be closed Friday as demonstrators plan protests and a statewide economic blackout to push back against the ongoing ICE enforcement in the state.
item.content:encoded: Many businesses in Minnesota will be closed Friday as demonstrators plan protests and a statewide economic blackout to push back against the ongoing ICE enforcement in the state.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Trump sues JPMorgan Chase and CEO Jamie Dimon for $5B
item.description: The president is seeking at least $5 billion in damages from the country's largest bank, alleging that it closed his accounts for political reasons.
item.content:encoded: The president is seeking at least $5 billion in damages from the country's largest bank, alleging that it closed his accounts for political reasons.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Trump pushes his power to new heights with help from loyal lieutenants
item.description: As President Trump finishes the first year of his second term, it is clear there are fewer guardrails than last time.
item.content:encoded:
As President Trump finishes the first year of his second term, it is clear there are fewer guardrails than last time.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Statewide economic blackout against ICE to be held in Minnesota Friday, Zelenskyy gives scorching critique of Europe in Davos speech, millions of Americans prepare for massive winter storm.
item.content:encoded: Statewide economic blackout against ICE to be held in Minnesota Friday, Zelenskyy gives scorching critique of Europe in Davos speech, millions of Americans prepare for massive winter storm.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: States prepare for potential widespread power outages as winter storm approaches
item.description: Heavy snow and ice is expected to affect a large portion of the South and Northeast this weekend. In North Carolina, officials are preparing for icy roads and potential power outages.
item.content:encoded: Heavy snow and ice is expected to affect a large portion of the South and Northeast this weekend. In North Carolina, officials are preparing for icy roads and potential power outages.
item.dc:creator: Laura Hackett

item.title: Palestinians say Jared Kushner's vision for Gaza erases what's left of their homes
item.description: Jared Kushner unveiled a vision of a futuristic cityscape for Gaza that includes skyscrapers and advanced industrial zones, but Palestinians fear his vision erases what remains of their homes.
item.content:encoded: Jared Kushner unveiled a vision of a futuristic cityscape for Gaza that includes skyscrapers and advanced industrial zones, but Palestinians fear his vision erases what remains of their homes.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: China's auto industry is rising as car manufacturing in the U.S. struggles
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to auto analyst Tu Le on the floor of the Detroit Auto Show about the rise of China's auto industry compared to the downturn in U.S. car manufacturing.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to auto analyst Tu Le on the floor of the Detroit Auto Show about the rise of China's auto industry compared to the downturn in U.S. car manufacturing.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: How one organization is trying to close the funding gap left by USAID's closure
item.description: In the wake of the USAID closure, philanthropies are trying to fill some of the gap. How one organization is trying to do the most good in the face of the sudden funding gap.
item.content:encoded: In the wake of the USAID closure, philanthropies are trying to fill some of the gap. How one organization is trying to do the most good in the face of the sudden funding gap.
item.dc:creator: Mary Childs

item.title: Singer-songwriter Lucinda Williams talks about her life and latest album
item.description: Singer-songwriter Lucinda Williams tapped into America's current period of struggle on her latest album, a collection of protest songs called "World's Gone Wrong."
item.content:encoded: Singer-songwriter Lucinda Williams tapped into America's current period of struggle on her latest album, a collection of protest songs called "World's Gone Wrong."
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep
